intro: Collomia debilis f. howardii, commonly known as the Howard's spikemoss, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Onagraceae, which includes willows and evening primroses. The plant features slender, upright stems covered in small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically pale pink to white, with four petals and prominent stamens. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and streamside habitats.
